attributes.action: End subsidy on alcohol purchases in Houses of Parliament/Lords/Commons.
attributes.additional_details:
The Speaker of the House refuses to provide information regarding the issue of alcohol consumption within the House.
http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/john-bercow-accused-of-covering-up-drinking-problems-in-parliament-where-a-pint-of-beer-costs-just-a6792821.html
attributes.background: Over £4million pound of UK taxes is used to subsidise the food and drink sold within the Houses of Parliament/Lords/Commons.  Whilst this keeps the MPs' expenses down, it means they pay about £2.60 for a pint WHILST AT WORK/ON DUTY.   Subsidies should be diverted to issues that benefit the public.
